title: 113_s1259
content: The Act titled "Assistance in Gaining Experience, Independence, and Navigation Act of 2013" or "AGE-IN Act" amends the Public Health Service Act to include grants for research, training, and navigator services for youth and young adults. The AGE-IN Act amends the Public Health Service Act to provide a research grant for a comprehensive meta-analysis on youth and young adults with autism spectrum disorder or other developmental disabilities transitioning out of the school-based support system. The Transition Navigator grant program aims to provide transitioning youth with support services including vocational training, integrated housing, transportation, and public safety programs. A strategic plan will be developed to ensure interdisciplinary coordination among service providers. The Transition Navigator grant program aims to provide comprehensive support services for transitioning youth, including postsecondary education, vocational training, self-advocacy skills, and competitive employment opportunities. The Transition Navigator grant program offers support services for transitioning youth, including postsecondary education, vocational training, self-advocacy skills, integrated employment, behavioral supports, residential services, health and wellness activities, and personal safety services. The program also emphasizes culturally and linguistically competent service delivery models. Transition Navigator grant program offers support services for transitioning youth, including postsecondary education, vocational training, self-advocacy skills, integrated employment, behavioral supports, residential services, health and wellness activities, and personal safety services. The program emphasizes culturally and linguistically competent service delivery models and grants awarded under this subsection shall be for a period of 2 years. The Transition Navigator Grant Program will provide multiyear training grants to establish collaborative initiatives for training transition navigators to support transitioning youth in leading independent lives. Eligible entities must be University Centers for Excellence. The Transition Navigator Grant Program provides training grants to University Centers for Excellence to establish initiatives for training transition navigators. Eligible entities must demonstrate the capacity to train service providers on best practice guidelines. The Transition Navigator Grant Program provides training grants to University Centers for Excellence to establish initiatives for training transition navigators. The application for the grant must include details such as the number of trainees expected to be trained, interdisciplinary scope of faculty and staff, ability to provide culturally sensitive training, and serving underserved populations. Grant period for Navigator training grants is specified. The Transition Navigator Grant Program awards grants for a 3-year period, with the possibility of renewal based on evaluations. Grantees must submit annual progress evaluations, including performance metrics, student recruitment, cultural diversity, and interdisciplinary aspects. The Secretary will contract with a third-party organization for a longitudinal evaluation of grantees' success in meeting strategic goals and grant application objectives. The organization will monitor and provide a detailed analysis of the program's effectiveness. The Secretary will contract with a third-party organization for a longitudinal evaluation of grantees' success in meeting strategic goals and grant application objectives, including analyzing the training program's effectiveness in meeting goals, graduates' success in providing services to transitional youth, and the long-term impact on transitional youth's postsecondary education enrollment and completion. The curr_chunk focuses on the key components for transitional youth, including vocational training, competitive employment, peer support, behavioral interventions, residential services, housing, transportation, and access to nutrition and wellness. The curr_chunk focuses on activities under a grant for transitional youth, supplementing existing programs, and authorizing appropriations for fiscal years 2014 through 2021.
